education_materials.title: Blood Pressure Measurement Instructions
education_materials.description: Diagram 1 shows how to perfectly take a blood pressure reading.
education_materials.author: John Doe

education_materials.title: Common Errors in Blood Pressure Measurement
education_materials.description: The last two diagrams show errors in taking blood pressure and how each error results in a wrong blood pressure recording (common errors and effects on accurate measurement).
education_materials.author: Rebecca Taylor

education_materials.title: Blood Pressure Chart
education_materials.description: The blood pressure chart helps understand blood pressure categories according to guidelines. Understanding these vital tools helps make lifestyle changes to control hypertension.
education_materials.author: Robert James

education_materials.title: Brief Summary of Blood Pressure Stages
education_materials.description: How to respond at each stage. The Hyper application provides more insights!
education_materials.author: Dr. Olivia Zhang

education_materials.title: Lifestyle Changes for Hypertension Management
education_materials.description: Having more knowledge about hypertension helps prevent serious negative side effects. The next pages will indicate essential lifestyle changes.
education_materials.author: Professor Jane Brown

education_materials.title: Hypertension Medication Reminder
education_materials.description: The Hypertension application is the best app to remind you to take medication regularly and avoid skipping, which may result in the domino effect. See page 14.
education_materials.author: Dr. Linda Green

education_materials.title: Controlling Blood Pressure for Best Results
education_materials.description: Being able to control conditions for normal blood pressure while on hypertensive medication is key to extra health benefits. The Hyper app helps with this.
education_materials.author: Dr. Emily White

education_materials.title: Stay on Track with Hypertension Medication
education_materials.description: Follow your hypertension medication plan by letting the Hyper app remind you. This will help you avoid the negative effects of skipping medication. Check your blood pressure, take your medication, and avoid the domino effect!
education_materials.author: Dr. Mark Johnson
